title: Infrastructure push: PM Modi tells bureaucrats to clear bottlenecks; focus on results

He wants faster project execution. He reviewed eight critical projects. These projects cover mines, railways and water resources. The projects span 15 states and UTs. The cumulative investment is over Rs 65,000 crore.

description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released the tentative datesheet for the 2026 Class 10 and 12 board exams. The examinations will commence on February 17, 2026, with Class 10 concluding on March 9 and Class 12 ending on April 9. Most papers will run from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, while select subjects are scheduled for shorter durations. A supplementary exam for Class 10 begins May 15, 2026.

title: Comedian-in-chief: Trump at UN - why world no longer takes him seriously

His 'America First' approach is isolating the US, prompting allies to question its reliability. Nations are hedging their bets, drawing closer to China and Russia, as Trump's unpredictability undermines US credibility.

title: Jimmy Kimmel returns: Why the joke is on America
description: Trump didn’t even have a functioning teleprompter. And yet he was funnier, than Jimmy Fallon, Stephen Colbert, John Oliver, and any other “comedian” that clings to a desk at 11PM and pretends to be America’s “conscience.” He was born with better comic timing than their monologues ever had. Every rally he holds is essentially a comedy special, complete with callbacks, audience interaction, and improv. No writers’ room, no punch-up meetings—just a septuagenarian free-styling nonsense that makes his crowd laugh harder than any Kimmel bit.

title: Gabrielle Union: ‘No job is worth unease’—on Hollywood’s dark side
description: Popular actress Gabrielle Union revealed how a past sexual assault shaped her Hollywood career. She avoids projects with unsettling individuals, prioritizing her well-being. Union values positive environments over financial gain. Despite past trauma, she achieved success. Her marriage to Dwyane Wade is strong. The couple focuses on family and business ventures. Wade supports Union, and they navigate life together.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix calls it 'tax'; founder says it will end lotteries
description: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.
